intro: Conophytum calculus subsp. vanzylii, commonly known as the Vanzylii conophytum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
